headline: The Red Cross
title: The Red Cross
creator: Thomas, Esther E.
description: After the outbreak of World War I and subsequently the influenza pandemic the American Red Cross mobilized thousands of individuals. In Moscow, to combat the war the Red Cross did everything they could from knitting socks to preparing bandages to be sent to soldiers. When the influenza pandemic came to the area they served as nurses, made flu masks and prepared meals for patients. Esther Thomas was a member of the American Red Cross beginning in 1917 by 1918 she served as a nurse at the university for patients of the influenza.
subject: Red Cross; nurses; World War I; spanish influenza
source: MG 170, Esther E. Thomas. Scrapbook, 1915-1919, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Inland Hospital
title: Inland Hospital Postcard
creator: Ott, Clifford M.
description: In 1918, while Dr. Carithers was drafted to serve during World War I, he allowed Inland Hospital to be used for patients of the pandemic from the university's Student Army Training Corps (SATC) while he was away. Inland Hospital served as the headquarters for SATC patients. The most severe cases would be sent to Gritman Memorial Hospital, while mild cases were sent to one of the auxiliary hospitals for recovery.
subject: hospitals; moscow; buildings; spanish influenza
source: PG 90, Clifford M. Ott Collection, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Armistice Day
title: "Angels of Mercy"
description: In the midst of the pandemic a peace agreement was reached ending World War I. Though quarantine was still in effect people in town and on the university still celebrated Armistice Day with a parade.
subject: Red Cross; Armistice Day; parades; moscow
source: PG 40, University of Idaho Alumni Association Photographs, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Auxiliary Hospitals
title: Alpha Kappa Epsilon House
creator: Thomas, Esther E.
description: Several houses and buildings in town were converted to auxiliary hospitals for influenza patients. The Alpha Kappa Epsilon house was converted into an auxiliary hospital for patients with mild symptoms of the influenza. The Elks Club House was also used for recovering patients.
subject: Spanish Influenza; hospitals; fraternities; houses
source: MG 202, Esther E. Thomas. Scrapbook, 1918-1925, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Fighting the Flu
title: "How To Strengthen Our Personal Defense Against Spanish Influenza"
creator: Richard, Charles
description: The university received a list of actions people could take to defend against the spread of the influenza from the Surgeon General. These actions include many that would be suggested today, such as avoiding crowds and covering coughs. Some other suggestions included: chewing your food well and avoiding tight clothes to "make nature your ally not your prisoner."
subject: Spanish Influenza; US Army; War Department; Student Army Training Corps; SATC; disease; illness; contagion; defense
source: UG 12, University of Idaho President's Office. Records, 1893-1965, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: SATC Deaths Due to Influenza
title: List of Men Who Died While In SATC
description: By the time the influenza had run its course the Student Army Training Corps (SATC) had approximately 200 cases with twelve deaths.
subject: University of Idaho; deaths; SATC; Student Army Training Corps; men; spanish influenza; list
source: UG 12, University of Idaho President's Office. Records, 1893-1965, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: President Ernest H. Lindley
title: President Ernest H. Lindley
description: Lindley served as President of the University of Idaho from 1917 to 1920. Beginning his presidency the same year the United States entered World War I, Lindley dealt with a loss of male students to the military, the establishment of the Student Army Training Corps on campus, and the outbreak of the Spanish Influenza.
subject: University of Idaho; administration; portraits; photograph; university; presidents; spanish influenza; world war I
source: PG 3, University of Idaho Portrait Collection, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. headline: Gritman Memorial Hospital
title: Gritman Hospital
description: The most severe cases from the university were sent to Gritman Hospital for care.

headline: The University Closes
title: U. Temporarily Closed Three Mild Cases of Flu - Page 1
creator: University Argonaut
description: Upon the arrival of members of the Student Army Training Corps (SATC) it was discovered that three showed mild symptoms of the influenza. In response the university closed temporarily in order to prevent the spread of the disease.
subject: University of Idaho; closures; spanish influenza; disease; epidemic; pandemic; illness; preventative measures; S.A.T.C.; Student Army Training Corps; cases
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Flu Masks
title: Everybody Must Wear Flu Masks - Page 1
creator: University Argonaut
description: The government issues an order at the end of October that all patients infected with the influenza were required to wear masks to prevent spreading the disease. Living groups on campus and members of the Red Cross worked to make these masks for the men.
subject: Co-eds; girls; women; sororities; Red Cross; S.A.T.C.; Student Army Training Corps; hospitals; government; spanish influenza; disease; illness; pandemic; epidemic; masks; face masks
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: The Community
title: Moscow People Care for the Sick - Page 3
creator: University Argonaut
description: Patients of the influenza were not only cared for by doctors and nurses, but also other community members. Women in home economics classes made meals for patients, members of the Red Cross worked as nurses, and members of the Moscow community opened their homes to house patients and help them recover.
subject: University of Idaho; S.A.T.C.; Student Army Training Corps; patients; Red Cross; care; epidemic; pandemic; illness; disease; town; Moscow; townspeople
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: SATC Sports
title: Football Practice Is Postponed - Page 2
creator: University Argonaut
description: With the influenza spreading throughout the Student Army Training Corps (SATC) sports games and practices were postponed. Coaches needed word from the medical officer before they were able to play again.
subject: football; activities; sport; S.A.T.C.; Student Army Training Corps; practice; spanish influenza; illness; disease; epidemic; pandemic
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Student Perspective
title: Student Petition
description: Students living in the dorms and the Beta Sig House signed a petition requesting that the administration cancel classes, school functions, and other duties until after the Thanksgiving Holiday due to the quarantine.
subject: Spanish Influenza; quarantine; students; University of Idaho
source: UG 12, University of Idaho President's Office. Records, 1893-1965, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

headline: State Quarantine
title: Telegram from Biwer Secy to President Lindley, October 20, 1918
creator: Secy, Biwer
description: October 20th, the university received word that the State Board of Health was enacting a quarantine on all state institutions.

headline: University Quarantine
title: University Affairs Feel The Quarantine - Page 2
creator: University Argonaut
description: Even though no university students had been diagnosed with the influenza, as a state institution the University of Idaho followed the order of the State Board of Health enacting a quarantine on campus.
subject: University of Idaho; activities; bans; students; school life; campus; town; illness; disease; epidemic; pandemic
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Patient Updates
title: Daily Report on Spanish Flu Patients
description: As more patients were diagnosed in the Student Army Training Corps (SATC) daily reports were kept on the number of admitted, discharged, and deaths relating to the influenza. The report also noted what sections of the SATC the men were from and the hospitals in which they were receiving treatment.
subject: Student Army Training Corps; SATC; report; health; patients; deaths; recoveries; diagnoses; men; Spanish Influenza
source: UG 12, University of Idaho President's Office. Records, 1893-1965, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Influenza Infects Female Students
title: Letter from President Lindley to Commissioner E.A. Bryan, November 18, 1918
creator: Lindley, Ernest H.
description: As the number of influenza cases amongst the Student Army Training Corps (SATC) began to wane, the influenza was found among the sorority houses. Though all the cases were mild the university set up a hospital for the afflicted women to recover.
subject: University of Idaho; girls; boys; men; women; spanish influenza; patients; sororities; hospitals; sickness; illness; disease; contagion; epidemic; pandemic; recoveries
source: UG 12, University of Idaho President's Office. Records, 1893-1965, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Material has passed into Public Domain based on date of creation. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

headline: Pneumonia
title: Letter from President Lindley to Commissioner E.A. Bryan, October 24, 1918
creator: Lindley, Ernest H.
description: Severe cases of the influenza could develop into a severe bacterial pneumonia. In most cases death was not caused by the influenza alone, but due to the pneumonia that would develop.
